names.pinyin: qing gan jian pi yang xin tang
names.english: clear the liver, build the spleen, and support the heart decoction
names.commonEnglish: Clear the Liver, Build the Spleen and Support the Heart Decoction

actions: Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness, strengthens the Spleen, harmonizes the Middle Jiao and transforms Phlegm.
With Bai Zhu, strengthens the Spleen and resolves Dampness.
Extinguishes Wind, alleviates spasms, drains Liver Heat and pacifies Liver Yang.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm and descends Rebellious Qi.
With Fu Ling, treats Phlegm, thin mucus and turbid Dampness.
Nourishes the Blood, calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind and alleviates pain.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
Tonifies the Spleen and augments Qi.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, Nourishes Yin and generates fluids.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold and stops pain due to Blood Stasis.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
Calms the Spirit, relieves constraint Regulates Qi, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood and stops pain.
With Bai Shao, for anxiety, irritability, worry and insomnia.
Tonifies the Spleen
Augments Qi
Eliminates Dampness
Nourishes the Blood
Extinguishes Wind
Alleviates Spasms
syndromes: Spleen Qi and Heart Blood Deficiency Generate Liver Wind

symptoms: Early menstruation with copious pale blood
Dizziness (mild and postural, worse with sitting or rising or lying down or when fatigued)
manifestations.pulse: Thready and weak or Thready and moderate
